title: Implement version command
description: Implement `rh version` command. Display: ranch-hand version, Rancher Desktop version (from API), backend type (WSL/Lima), k3s version, containerd version, kubectl version. Support --json flag.

title: Implement start/stop/restart/status commands
description: Implement backend control commands: `rh start`, `rh stop`, `rh restart`, `rh status`. Use GET/PUT /v1/backend_state API. Display backend states: STARTED, STOPPED, STARTING, STOPPING, ERROR, DISABLED.

title: Polish and Documentation
description: Final polish including error messages, JSON output consistency, integration tests, and documentation.

title: Ensure consistent --json output for all commands
description: Audit all commands for --json flag support. Ensure consistent JSON structure across commands. Document JSON output schemas.

title: Implement certs check command
description: Implement `rh certs check` command. Test SSL connectivity to: api.github.com, github.com, storage.googleapis.com, desktop.version.rancher.io, docs.rancherdesktop.io. Show certificate issuer/chain info, detect corporate proxy certs. Support --insecure and --json flags. Provide recommendations for IT SSL bypass.

title: API Commands
description: Implement commands for interacting with the Rancher Desktop HTTP API including generic API access, version info, backend control, and settings management.

title: Add CI status badges to README
description:
Add useful badges to README.md for project visibility:

- GitHub Actions CI status badge
- License badge (MIT)
- Rust version / MSRV badge
- Crates.io version badge (once published)
- Code coverage badge (once coverage reporting is added)
- Documentation badge (once docs are published)

Consider using shields.io for consistent badge styling.

title: Add code coverage reporting to CI
description: Add code coverage reporting to the GitHub Actions CI workflow. Consider using cargo-tarpaulin or cargo-llvm-cov for coverage generation and uploading results to Codecov or Coveralls for tracking coverage trends.

title: Network Diagnostics
description: Implement network diagnostic commands for SSL certificate checking and comprehensive Rancher Desktop diagnostics.

title: Core Infrastructure
description: Set up the foundational architecture for ranch-hand CLI including project structure, CLI framework, platform abstractions, HTTP client, and configuration loading.

title: Implement SHA256 checksum verification utility
description: Create utils/checksum.rs for SHA256 verification. Parse sha256sum-{arch}.txt format. Verify downloaded files against checksums. Report mismatches with clear error messages.

title: Implement api command
description: Implement `rh api <endpoint>` command for generic API access. Support --method (GET/PUT/POST/DELETE), --body <json>, --input <file>. Pretty-print JSON output by default, --raw for unformatted.

title: Implement cache list command
description: Implement `rh cache list` command. List cached k3s versions with status (verified/incomplete/checksum mismatch). Show file sizes, total cache size, and cache location. Support --json flag for machine-readable output. Verify checksums for each cached version.

title: Implement settings command
description: Implement `rh settings` command. Subcommands: (default) show all, `get <path>` for specific setting, `set <path> <value>`, `reset` for factory reset. Use dot notation (kubernetes.version). Validate via /v1/propose_settings. Support --json. Show restart required warnings.

title: Add cargo-deny for dependency auditing
description: Add cargo-deny to CI for dependency auditing. This checks for security vulnerabilities, license compliance, and duplicate dependencies. Create a deny.toml configuration file and add a CI job to run cargo-deny check.

title: Implement Rancher Desktop API client
description: Create client/api.rs with typed Rancher Desktop API client. Handle authentication from rd-engine.json. Implement methods for common endpoints: /v1/settings, /v1/backend_state, /v1/diagnostic_checks, /v1/propose_settings.

title: HTTP client with certificate bypass support
description: Create client/http.rs with reqwest-based HTTP client. Support --insecure flag to bypass SSL validation. Implement interactive prompt when certificate error detected (without --insecure). Detect corporate proxy certificates.

title: Optimize cargo-husky caching in CI
description: The workflow already uses rust-cache, but consider also caching cargo-husky installation to speed up first builds. Investigate if additional caching strategies would improve CI performance for new contributors.

title: CLI framework with clap
description: Set up main.rs and cli.rs with clap derive macros. Define global options (--insecure, --config, --json, --verbose, --quiet) and subcommand structure for all planned commands.

title: Add CONTRIBUTING.md documentation
description:
Create a CONTRIBUTING.md file explaining:
- The pre-commit hooks and how to bypass them (git commit --no-verify)
- How to run CI locally (cargo fmt --check, cargo clippy -- -D warnings, cargo test)
- The purpose of RH_PRE_COMMIT_TEST=1 environment variable
- Development workflow and coding standards

title: Add cargo-husky and pre-commit hooks
description: Set up cargo-husky for Git pre-commit hooks. Configure hooks to run: cargo fmt --check, cargo clippy, cargo test. Ensure hooks are automatically installed when developers run cargo build.

title: Project setup with Cargo
description: Initialize the Rust project with Cargo.toml including all required dependencies: clap, tokio, reqwest, serde, sha2, dirs, indicatif, colored, dialoguer, thiserror, anyhow, futures-util, and platform-specific deps.

title: Add GitHub Actions CI workflow
description: Create .github/workflows/ci.yml with: cargo fmt --check, cargo clippy -- -D warnings, cargo test, cargo build --release. Run on push and PR to main. Test on ubuntu-latest, windows-latest, macos-latest.

title: Implement diagnose command
description: Implement `rh diagnose` command with comprehensive checks: 1) Application status (running, API connectivity, backend state), 2) Platform-specific checks (WSL/Lima/QEMU), 3) k3s/Kubernetes status, 4) Cache status, 5) Network diagnostics (DNS, HTTPS, certs). Output with [OK]/[WARN]/[FAIL] status indicators.

title: Implement download progress display utility
description: Create utils/progress.rs using indicatif for download progress bars. Support multiple concurrent downloads with multi-progress bar. Show download speed, ETA, and percentage complete.

title: Improve error messages and help text
description: Review and improve all error messages for clarity. Add helpful context and recovery suggestions. Ensure clap help text is comprehensive with examples.

title: Cache Commands
description: Implement cache management commands for listing and populating the k3s cache with proper checksum verification and progress display.

title: Implement cache populate command
description: Implement `rh cache populate <version>` command. Download k3s binary, airgap images (.tar.zst with .tar fallback), and checksums from GitHub releases. Features: --insecure flag for SSL bypass, interactive cert error prompt, parallel downloads, SHA256 verification, progress bars, automatic arch detection (amd64/arm64).

title: Config/credential loading from rd-engine.json
description: Implement config.rs to load credentials from rd-engine.json (user, password, host, port). Support override via --user, --password, --host, --port CLI flags. Handle case when file doesn't exist (Rancher Desktop not running).

title: Write README documentation
description: Create README.md with installation instructions, usage examples for all commands, configuration options, and troubleshooting guide for SSL/cert issues in corporate environments.

title: Platform-specific path resolution
description: Implement paths.rs module with functions to resolve cache paths and config paths for Windows, macOS, and Linux. Cache: Windows=%LOCALAPPDATA%\rancher-desktop\cache\k3s, macOS=~/Library/Caches/rancher-desktop/k3s, Linux=~/.cache/rancher-desktop/k3s. Config: rd-engine.json locations per platform.

title: Verify Windows compatibility for pre-commit hooks
description:
The pre-commit hook is shell-based (.cargo-husky/hooks/pre-commit). Verify it works with Git for Windows (Git Bash). If there are compatibility issues, consider:
- Adding a .ps1 PowerShell version
- Documenting Windows-specific setup in CONTRIBUTING.md
- Testing on Windows CI to catch issues early

title: Write integration tests
description: Create integration tests in tests/integration/. Unit tests for path resolution, checksum verification. Integration tests with mock HTTP server for download and API commands. Test on Windows (WSL), macOS, Linux.

title: Add CI status badge to README
description: Add a GitHub Actions CI status badge to the README.md file to show the current build status at a glance.
